00020 /*
00021  * \file   tsv-test.cpp
00022  * \brief  Tests for TsvFile reading and writing.
00023  *         This program checks that TsvFile is working as expected.
00024  */

00040 void
00041 check_trim()
00042 {
00043   std::string trimstr1=" \t1 2 3\t ";
00044   std::string trimstr1s="     1 2 3     ";
00045   std::string trimstr2;
00046 
00047   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00048   ltrim(trimstr2);
00049   //printf("ltrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00050   assert(trimstr2=="1 2 3\t ");
00051 
00052   trimstr2=trimstr1s;
00053   rtrim(trimstr2);
00054   //printf("rtrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00055   assert(trimstr2=="     1 2 3");
00056 
00057   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00058   rtrim(trimstr2);
00059   //printf("rtrim: '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00060   assert(trimstr2==" \t1 2 3");
00061 
00062   trimstr2=trimstr1;
00063   trim(trimstr2);
00064   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00065   assert(trimstr2=="1 2 3");
00066 
00067   trimstr2="abc";
00068   trim(trimstr2);
00069   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00070   assert(trimstr2=="abc");
00071 
00072   trimstr2="";
00073   trim(trimstr2);
00074   //printf("trim:  '%s'\n",trimstr2.c_str());
00075   assert(trimstr2=="");
00076 }
00077 
00079 #define CHECK_DEQUOTE(Xstr1,Xstr2) \
00080   str1=Xstr1; \
00081   str2=str1;  \
00082   dequote(str2); \
00083   if (0) printf("dequote('%s')=='%s'\n",str1.c_str(),str2.c_str());  \
00084   assert(str2==Xstr2);
00085 
00087 void
00088 check_dequote()
00089 {
00090   std::string str1;
00091   std::string str2;
00092 
00093   CHECK_DEQUOTE("abc","abc");
00094   CHECK_DEQUOTE("'abc'","abc");
00095   CHECK_DEQUOTE("'abc","'abc");
00096   CHECK_DEQUOTE("abc'","abc'");
00097   CHECK_DEQUOTE("''","");
00098   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"","\"");
00099   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\'","\'");
00100   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"abc\"","abc");
00101   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\'abc\"","\'abc\"");
00102   CHECK_DEQUOTE("\"abc\'","\"abc\'");
00103 }

00107 void
00108 check_splitstr_print(std::vector<std::string>& strvec)
00109 {
00110   printf("#---\n");
00111   for (unsigned int i=0;i<strvec.size();++i) {
00112     printf("%3d:%s\n",i,strvec[i].c_str());
00113   }
00114 }
00115 
00117 void
00118 check_splitstr()
00119 {
00120   std::vector<std::string> strvec;
00121   std::string str;
00122 
00123   str="a-b-c"; // ("a","b","c")
00124   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00125   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00126   assert(strvec.size()==3);
00127 
00128   str=""; // ("")
00129   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00130   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00131   assert(strvec.size()==1);
00132 
00133   str="-"; // ("","")
00134   splitstr(str,'-',strvec);
00135   //check_splitstr_print(strvec);
00136   assert(strvec.size()==2);
00137 }

00141 void
00142 check_field_name()
00143 {
00144   affx::TsvFile* tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00145   std::string cname;
00146   int cidx;
00147 
00148   cname="abc";
00149   tsv->defineColumn(0,1,cname);
00150   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00151   //printf("0:%s=%d\n",cname.c_str(),cidx);
00152   assert(cidx==1);
00153 
00154   cname="def";
00155   tsv->defineColumn(0,10,cname);
00156   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00157   //printf("0:%s=%d\n",cname.c_str(),cidx);
00158   assert(cidx==10);
00159 
00160   // Make sure the alias finds it
00161   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1",cname);
00162   assert(cidx==10);
00163   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2",cname);
00164   assert(cidx==10);
00165   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3",cname);
00166   assert(cidx==10);
00167 
00168   //
00169   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1");
00170   assert(cidx==10);
00171   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1","bogus2");
00172   assert(cidx==10);
00173   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3");
00174   assert(cidx==10);
00175 
00176   //
00177   cname="xyz";
00178   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,cname);
00179   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00180 
00181   // Make sure the alias dont find it
00182   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1",cname);
00183   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00184   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2",cname);
00185   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00186   cidx=tsv->cname2cidx(0,"bogus1","bogus2","bogus3",cname);
00187   assert(cidx==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00188 
00189   //
00190   delete tsv;
00191 }

00194 void
00195 check_field_convert()
00196 {
00197   affx::TsvFileField col;
00198   double val_double;
00199   int val_int;
00200   int rv;
00201 
00202   // a good int conversion
00203   col.clear();
00204   col.setBuffer("123");
00205   rv=col.get(val_int);
00206   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_int==123));
00207   rv=col.get(val_int);
00208   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_int==123));
00209 
00210   // a bad int conversion
00211   col.clear();
00212   col.setBuffer("abc");
00213   rv=col.get(val_int);
00214   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00215   rv=col.get(val_int);
00216   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00217 
00218   // a bad int conversion
00219   col.clear();
00220   col.setBuffer("123.4");
00221   rv=col.get(val_int);
00222   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00223   rv=col.get(val_int);
00224   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_int==-1));
00225 
00226   // a good double conversion
00227   col.clear();
00228   col.setBuffer("123.5");
00229   rv=col.get(val_double);
00230   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5));
00231   rv=col.get(val_double);
00232   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5));
00233 
00234   // exponent
00235   col.clear();
00236   col.setBuffer("123.5e6");
00237   rv=col.get(val_double);
00238   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5e6));
00239   rv=col.get(val_double);
00240   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(val_double==123.5e6));
00241 
00242   // a bad double conversion
00243   col.clear();
00244   col.setBuffer("abc");
00245   rv=col.get(val_double);
00246   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00247   rv=col.get(val_double);
00248   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00249 
00250   // bad partial
00251   col.setBuffer("123abc");
00252   rv=col.get(val_double);
00253   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00254   rv=col.get(val_double);
00255   assert((rv==TSV_ERR_CONVERSION)&&(val_double==-1));
00256 }
00257 
00259 void
00260 check_headers()
00261 {
00262   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00263   std::string key;
00264   std::string val;
00265 
00266   // should be empty at start
00267   tsv.headersBegin();
00268   while (tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
00269     assert(0);
00270   }
00271 
00272   // add one and get the value.
00273   std::string test_str_in="test_val";
00274   std::string test_str_out;
00275   tsv.addHeader("test_str_1",test_str_in);
00276   tsv.getHeader("test_str_1",test_str_out);
00277   assert(test_str_out==test_str_in);
00278   // should fail.
00279   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_str_none",test_str_out)!=TSV_OK);
00280 
00281   int test_int_in=123;
00282   int test_int_out=0;
00283   tsv.addHeader("test_int_1",test_int_in);
00284   tsv.getHeader("test_int_1",test_int_out);
00285   assert(test_int_out==test_int_in);
00286   //
00287   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_int_none",test_int_out)!=TSV_OK);
00288 
00289   double test_double_in=123.456;
00290   double test_double_out=0;
00291   tsv.addHeader("test_double_1",test_double_in);
00292   tsv.getHeader("test_double_1",test_double_out);
00293   assert(test_double_out==test_double_in);
00294   // should fail
00295   assert(tsv.getHeader("test_double_none",test_double_out)!=TSV_OK);
00296 
00297   // They should remain in the order added.
00298   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00299     tsv.addHeader("a",i);
00300     tsv.addHeader("b",i);
00301     tsv.addHeader("c",i);
00302     tsv.addHeaderComment("comment");
00303   }
00304   //tsv.dump_headers();
00305 
00306   //
00307   tsv.headersBegin();
00308   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00309     tsv.headersFindNext("b",val);
00310     assert(i==strtol(val.c_str(),NULL,0));
00311   }
00312 
00313   // no header returned by headersNext should be blank
00314   tsv.headersBegin();
00315   while (tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
00316     //printf("#%s=%s\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
00317     assert(key!="");
00318   }
00319 }

00322 
00324 void
00325 check_read_table_1()
00326 {
00327   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00328   int val_ref=0;
00329   int val_col;
00330 
00331   tsv.openTable("data-table-1.txt");
00332 
00333   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00334     int cidx=0;
00335     //printf("num=%3d: lvl=%3d:",tsv.lineNumber(),tsv.lineLevel());
00336     while ((cidx<tsv.getColumnCount(tsv.lineLevel())) &&
00337            (tsv.get(tsv.lineLevel(),cidx,val_col)==TSV_OK)) {
00338       //printf("%s(%d=%d)",((cidx==0)?"":"\t"),val_ref,val_col);
00339       assert(val_col==val_ref);
00340       val_ref++;
00341       cidx++;
00342     }
00343     //printf("\n");
00344   }
00345   tsv.close();
00346 }

00351 void
00352 check_headers_1()
00353 {
00354   affx::TsvFile tsv_a;
00355   affx::TsvFile tsv_z;
00356   affx::TsvFile tsv_0;
00357   std::string key;
00358   std::string val;
00359   std::string val_out;
00360   int val_out_int;
00361   int i;
00362   int i_max=10;
00363   int rv;
00364 
00365   rv=tsv_a.getHeader("No header",val);
00366   assert(rv==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00367 
00368   for (i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00369     std::ostringstream stream;
00370     stream << i;
00371     val=stream.str();
00372     key="key_"+val;
00373     tsv_a.addHeader(key,val,i);
00374     tsv_a.addHeaderComment("123");
00375     tsv_z.addHeader(key,val,i_max-i-1);
00376     tsv_0.addHeader(key,val,0);
00377     tsv_0.addHeaderComment(val);
00378     //
00379     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val);
00380     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00381     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key+"not found",val);
00382     assert(rv==TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
00383   }
00384   assert(tsv_a.headerCount()==(2*i_max));
00385 
00386   //
00387   //tsv_a.dump_headers();
00388   //tsv_z.dump_headers();
00389   assert((tsv_z.headerCount())==(1*i_max));
00390   tsv_z.resortHeaders();
00391   assert((tsv_z.headerCount())==(1*i_max));
00392   //tsv_z.dump_headers();
00393 
00394   // should be in the correct order
00395   for (i=0;i<10;i++) {
00396     std::ostringstream stream;
00397     stream << i;
00398     val=stream.str();
00399     key="key_"+val;
00400 
00401     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val_out);
00402     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00403     assert(val_out==val);
00404 
00405     rv=tsv_a.getHeader(key,val_out_int);
00406     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00407     assert(val_out_int==i);
00408 
00409     rv=tsv_z.getHeader(key,val_out);
00410     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00411     assert(val_out==val);
00412   }
00413   //
00414   tsv_a.writeTsv("check-a.tsv");
00415   tsv_a.close();
00416   tsv_z.writeTsv("check-z.tsv");
00417   tsv_z.close();
00418   tsv_0.writeTsv("check-0.tsv");
00419   tsv_0.close();
00420 }

00422 #define CH2_CNT 10
00423 
00425 void
00426 check_headers_2()
00427 {
00428   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00429   int rv;
00430 
00431   for (int i=0;i<CH2_CNT;i++) {
00432     tsv.addHeader("abc",i);
00433   }
00434 
00435   std::string val;
00436   tsv.headersBegin();
00437   for (int i=0;i<CH2_CNT;i++) {
00438     rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00439     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00440   }
00441   
00442   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00443   assert(rv!=TSV_OK);
00444 
00445   //
00446   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("def",val);
00447   assert(rv!=TSV_OK);
00448   rv=tsv.headersFindNext("abc",val);
00449   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00450 }

00455 void
00456 check_csv_1()
00457 {
00458   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00459   int rv;
00460   std::string tmpstr;
00461   double tmpdbl;
00462 
00463   //rv=tsv.openCsv("./data-test-2.csv");
00464   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-2.csv");
00465   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00466 
00467   //tsv.dump();
00468 
00469   // The first four lines are all variations of "1,2,3"
00470   for (int i=0;i<4;i++) {
00471     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00472     //printf("check_csv_1: line=%3d:",i);
00473     tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr);
00474     //printf(" '%s',",tmpstr.c_str());
00475     //printf("\n");
00476     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="1"));
00477     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==1.0));
00478     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="2"));
00479     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==2.0));
00480     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="3"));
00481     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpdbl); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpdbl==3.0));
00482   }    
00483 
00484   for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00485     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00486     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"1\""));
00487     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"2\""));
00488     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\"3\""));
00489   }    
00490 
00491   // a mixed up line ("1",",","3\"")
00492   rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00493   rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==",1"));
00494   rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==","));
00495   rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="\""));
00496 
00497   // escaped field seps. ("1,",",2",3\,4)
00498   for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00499     rv=tsv.nextLevel(0);    assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00500     rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="1,\""));
00501     rv=tsv.get(0,1,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr==",2'"));
00502     rv=tsv.get(0,2,tmpstr); assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="3,4"));
00503   }
00504 
00505   // check we are at the end -- move to the next line and get it.
00506   // # next line is end of file
00507   rv=tsv.nextLine();
00508   assert((rv==TSV_OK));
00509   //assert((tsv.lineLevel()==TSV_LINE_COMMENT));
00510   // end-of-file
00511   rv=tsv.nextLine();
00512   assert((rv==TSV_OK)&&(tsv.lineLevel()==0));
00513   rv=tsv.get(0,0,tmpstr);
00514   assert((rv==TSV_OK) && (tmpstr=="end-of-file"));
00515 
00516   tsv.close();
00517 }

00520 void
00521 check_nextline()
00522 {
00523   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00524   int rv;
00525 
00526   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-2.csv");
00527   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00528 
00529   while ((rv=tsv.nextLine())==TSV_OK) {
00530     printf(" %3d : %3d\n",tsv.lineNumber(),tsv.lineLevel());
00531   }
00532   tsv.close();
00533 }

00537 void
00538 check_index_1()
00539 {
00540   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00541   int rv;
00542   int file_key,file_val;
00543 
00544   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-3.tsv");
00545   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00546 
00547   rv=tsv.defineIndex(0,"key",TSV_INDEX_INT,0);
00548   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00549 
00550   // negative control
00551   rv=tsv.findBegin(0,"key",TSV_OP_EQ,999);
00552   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00553   rv=tsv.findNext();
00554   assert(rv==TSV_FIND_LAST);
00555 
00556   // positive
00557   for (int key=1;key<10;key++) {
00558     rv=tsv.findBegin(0,"key",TSV_OP_EQ,key);
00559     assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00560 
00561     int num_found=0;
00562     while (tsv.findNext()==TSV_OK) {
00563       num_found++;
00564       //
00565       rv=tsv.get(0,"key",file_key);
00566       assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00567       rv=tsv.get(0,"val",file_val);
00568       assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00569       //printf(" %2d : %2d => %2d\n",key,file_key,file_val);
00570       assert(file_key==key);
00571       assert(file_val==(101*key));
00572     }
00573     assert(num_found==1);
00574   }
00575   tsv.close();
00576 }

00579 void
00580 check_winpath_1()
00581 {
00582   int rv;
00583   std::string pathname;
00584   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00585   rv=tsv.open("./data-test-winpath.txt");
00586   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00587   tsv.m_optEscapeOk=false;
00588 
00589   tsv.nextLevel(0);
00590   rv=tsv.get(0,"pathname",pathname);
00591   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00592   //printf("pathname='%s'\n",pathname.c_str());
00593   assert(pathname=="C:\\some\\path\\to\\a\\file.txt");
00594   
00595   tsv.close();
00596 }

00604 int
00605 main(int argc,char* argv[])
00606 {
00607   // Tests the strings
00608   check_trim();
00609   check_splitstr();
00610   check_dequote();
00611   //
00612   check_field_name();
00613   check_field_convert();
00614   check_headers();
00615   //
00616   check_read_table_1();
00617   //
00618   check_headers_1();
00619   //
00620   check_csv_1();
00621   //
00622   check_index_1();
00623   //
00624   check_winpath_1();
00625   //
00626   printf("ok.\n");
00627 }
